sentences: Ma ostaksin k√µike, mis mulle meeldib.
context: The Estonian word 'ostan' is the first-person singular present tense form of the verb 'ostma', which means 'to buy'. It is used when the speaker is currently performing the action of buying something. The root 'ost-' relates to commerce and purchasing, and the ending '-an' indicates first person (I) and present tense. This word belongs to the regular conjugation group in Estonian.
